reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing, it's like re-living good ol' MechWarrior except it has original and innovative mechanics of it's own.

Each mech has its own special skill, for example the Reaper.
A light frontline sniper build having an ability called 'Precision Overdrive' which grants its user increased accuracy and precision for a short period.

They also come with a cute little repair drone that fixes you up when you need it!
However it is recommended that you stay out of combat while doing so, your Mech is rendered immobile and unable to attack.

What I don't like are some of the maps, specifically Uptown and Origin.
Their designs can cause a lot of problems navigating, you honestly can get confused whether that hole you're boosting towards is even an entrance/exit to a tunnel.

Other than that this game is amazing and has loads of potential, just try and keep your cash close to you.
The items available for purchasing in-game are kind of...costly.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nA fanstastic, standout game that blends mech combat tactics and FPS twitch shooting very well.  Beatuifully designed and realized, the world of HAWKEN almost demands a story, which sadly you don't really recieve.  However, the game still drags you in with a simplistic immersiveness that lives up to (and surpasses) many other shooters and mech games.  The HUD has gone through some mechanics and design changes over the months, but the core gameplay remains the same: lean, fast, and brutal.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well, now that I have a decent amount of time in HAWKEN, I might as well wright a decent review for it.  First of all, there are very few shooters that I can think of that are like it: a first-person, fast paced mech shooter.  The concept is very interesting, the mech designs are unique and thought out, and the weapons are (for the most part) balanced.  The sound design is fantastic, with missiles whooshing, bullets pinging and ringing, Thumping explosions are very satisfying, the feet of your mech thumping methodically on the ground, ad the ambience of the environment surrounding you during rare moments of silence.  The graphics are steller, and even though im only running it on a mix of medium/high settings, it still looks gorgeous, considering it is several years old already.

I would talk about how the devs have abandoned the game (they did), but that doesn't matter now, as a new studio has purchased the I.P., and from the recent posts on the HAWKEN Facebook page, it seems like the new devs have their heads screwed on straight about the destiny of HAWKEN. Having been playing HAWKEN on and off since Alpha 2, I have rekindled hope for this game to become something great again. I just hope they nerf the Incinerator and Scout :)

The game has several game modes, inculding the classic Team Deathmatch as well as free-for-all Deathmatch.  It has a special co-op mode for fighting waves of A.I. drones with 3 of your friends, and a mode called Siege (don't play this mode, it is either super easy or a pitiful smackdown for you), that involves collecting energy to lauch a 'battleship' which then attacked the enemy's base; the first team to have their base destroyed loses.

The small community of driven players have kept this game alive, and the new devs say they are going to use us to help shape HAWKEN's future, so who know what happens next?

8.5/10

Hoping we get an announcement or some kind of update soon otherwise this game is dead. SILENCE IS SUICIDE FOR DEVS.

To anyone not recommending this title because of the lack of updates, that's a sure fire way to kill the game faster. We need people to play this game so the devs have a reason to come back.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPretty solid game for early access, plus it free which is always a plus for a good game. Maps are pretty big, mulitleveled, and well laid out. One down-side I have with this game currently is that there is no filter for the matchmaking, meaning you can and will go up against people that are the max level and have played much more than yourself. Now this isn't that big of a down side since you could level the playing field by spending some cash to buy better mechs, or my preffered option which is play the game and get better. I haven't ran into a mech that was too 'OP' and overused as of yet so the game is pretty well balanced. With the right level of skill, the beginner mechs (the ones you acquire/start with first) can easily beat out the more expensive ones. Have fun and enjoy this game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Some kind of FPS but with a Mech, like the ones in Avatar or something, big bad robots that you control. I got through the training stages and got to online play but that was all.
It seemed promising at the training but when in online, after a while I got bored, or at least didn't find the call to play again.

Over all, very interesting game, nice graphics. The control of the mech seemed a little to complex but not impossible to learn.

Because it is free to play, it certainly worth giving a try.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is truly incredible.  It is such a well balanced and deep game.  There are dozens of mechs, and each one is completely unique in how you have to use it to be successful on the battlefield.  And when you figure out how to use each mech, it's a powerful resource to the battlefield.  The gameplay is extremely fun also, with dodging, different mech speeds and sizes, and tactical teamwork always coming into play.  For thost looking for a game to get good at, this one fits the bill.  The mechanics allow for an impossibly high skill ceiling, and the complex movement ensures that hackers aren't even that big of a deal.  The game also intoduces an awesome game mode called Siege, where the team fights for resources to launc battlehips that go and ♥♥♥♥ up the enemy base.  Once launched, the teams fight over the Anti-Air to either shoot down the enemy ship or keep the AA from the hands of the enemies,  It's a very unique and fin game mode.

Pros:
+ Excellent gameplay
+ Near perfect mech-tp-mech balance
+ Team-oriented
+ Long-term interest
+ Good newbie gameplay, but has an impossibly high skill ceiling

Cons:
- Sometimes hard to find games
- Can be a little grindy, though the developers are always making tweaks to the economy
- Team balance isn't perfected, many one-sided games
